intro: Triglochin multifructa, commonly known as the many-fruited glassworts, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, greenish flowers. The plant thrives in brackish or saline environments, often found in coastal marshes and estuaries. Its root system helps stabilize soil, making it ecologically significant in tidal zones. Triglochin multifructa is also valued for its ability to tolerate fluctuating water levels and salinity.
